answers.answer: I was just prescribed a drug called Clomid 50mg. Its supposed to be one of the best fertility drugs on the market right now. We are on oir first round right now. (Takes 3 rounds).
If u end up not wanting to go thru the prescription process you can prder them off line.. :) hopes this helps. Its also been 1.5 years for us...
My Dr took me off birthcontrol today and proscribed me merphorman it's a diabetes drug that also helps pcos.
Thank you for the suggestions! I'm trying to go the prescription free way though. I'll talk to my Dr next appointment

First of all if u and your partner have not had a full fertility work up...it's time to do so!!! And as for drugs you buy on line...stay away....and you want a Dr to be watching over you when taking these kinds of meds.Good luck!!!!

Thank you! When I said prescription free I meant pill free all together. The doctor said I could be getting pregnant by July. I started taking prenatal vitamins and am doing a lot more physical movement and eating healthier. If I'm not regular by July I will go back to my doctor and try a different method as well as having my husband have a fertility check up.
you can also try Vitex.  it is a vitamin from the health food store that is supposed to work like metaformin does and help with infertility

question: My husband and I have been trying for a baby for 3 years now with no luck. I was diagnosed with PCOS and got but on birth control. I'm off now. Does anyone know anything that will increase my chances of becoming pregnant?
title: It's been 3 years...
